text:
(tap 0,5l @ OP (Brno))
Aroma: Toasty, malty, light sweet.
Appearance: Clear red color. Medium, beige head.
Taste: Light sweet, malty, light caramel.
Palate: Long light dry finish.
Overall: Tasty. Toasty-malty.

From tap, pours light cloudy amber liquid, big frothy tan head, Aroma: malty, caramel, Taste: medium sweet, light to medium bitter, light sour, malty, caramel, sweet finish, some minor hoppy notes, Palate: medium body, average carbonation, slick to creamy mouthfeel, long sweet caramel aftertaste, Overall: fine amber lager, enjoyed.
deep amber copper color. high pillowy beige head. palate heavy. carbed mild. aroma cherry caramel and eggs. taste caramel coffee and honey. balanced. ok. not my cup of coffee.

Čapované v Beer Time Nitra. Tmavšia, priehladná farba, jemne nahnedlá nižšia pena, sladová aróma. stredná rezkost, slad, karamelky, na konci jemná horkost. Dobré polotmavé pivo.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

13/VII/15 - 1L bottle from Potraviny food market (Plzeň) @ home - BB: 13/VII/15 (2015-923)  
Clear reddish amber beer, small creamy off-white head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: sweet, lots of caramel, sweet malts, some dried fruits. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: sweet malty start, caramel, some dried fruits, honey, little sourish. Aftertaste: bit hoppy, sweet malts, some caramel, dried fruits, ripe banana, malty, nice bitterness!

Keg (Hilpea Haukki, Helsinki)
Nice mahogany, small tight head. Pleasant sweet nutty woody aroma. Sweet mashy body, a little under-attenuated for my tastes. A little bit husky, but quite bland. Full palate, carbonation quite high though. Finish mashy, a little nutty and sweet. Unimpressed.

Keg at the Brewpub in Slany Day 5 of Fergus and Sarahs Czech jaunt. 3/10/14. Clear reddy / copper coloured pour, with a fleetinghalo of sticky cream head. Aroma is sweet biscuity and toasted malts, toffee, unrefined sugars. Flavour is composed of brown bread, toasted malts, light jammy fruits, rye spice and a touch of sweet toffe, but rounds out nicely. Palate is just beautiful, just melts in the mouth, slightly creamy, highish carbonation. Really tasty, very good balance.

Draught. Pours unclear amber in color with an off-white head. Hay, doughy yeasty and caramel notes in aroma. Malty notes, sweet hard toffee and some grassyness in taste. More of bitters and sort of green herbs mixed with a nice touch of maltyness in the end. Actually theres quite lot of grainy notes here, which is okay. Well balanced and tasty.

(Keg at William K Annankatu, 20141220) The beer poured dark brown and clear. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had grass, malts and molasses. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were grass, malts, molasses, butter, sweetness and bitterness. Aftertaste had molasses, butter, sweetness and bitterness. An easily drinkable malty Czech beer.

Malty, slight worty, nose. Some red berries. Dry, some amlty sweetness. Pretty nice red fruityness. Ireally like the full flavour here.-- bb

Tap @ William K, Annankatu. Mahogany color, thin off white head. Bready, toffee, hoppy, light buttery aroma. Flavor has toffee, white bread, light buttery notes in flavor as well. Long sweetish finish. Dried fruits. Just awesome. So good.
Bottle. Copper color with tiny white head. Aroma - Fruits, honey, sweets. cake. Nice sweet taste.
Tap at Olutexpo 2014, Helsinki. Colour is reddish copper with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Grain, some sweetness and malts. Nice and drinkable.

3rd Oct 2014, 0.3 litre on-tap pour in Pivovarsky Klub, Prague: listed as Antos 13 Polotmavy Special, assume this is it.

 Pours a deep amber, chestnut red with a creamy head. Aroma was caramel malty with a slight smokiness. Taste wise it was as the smell, caramel sweetness with a mild hint of smoke. The hops came late on and I thought the body was rich and deep.
Tap at Le Senk, Bratislava.  Amber color with medium off-white head. Caramel malt, red fruits in aroma. Taste, malt, caramel, harsh bitterness in finish.

1 litre PET bottle from the grocers on the square in pilsen. copperish with a lingering off-beige head; aroma of strawberry jam; pleasant caramel flavours tending towards a touch medicinal in the finish

Vycap Starosloviensky pivovar. Krasna jantarova farba, kremova husta pena. Vona jemne sladova, ovocna. Telo stredne plne, chyba vacsia nasytenost. V chuti sladovost, jemne ovocne a karamelove tony. Velmi pitelne.

Tap at Starosloviensky. Aroma caramel, fruity, light light chocolate. Clear amber colour. Moderate duration of head. Taste is quite clean, soft mouthfeel, easily drinkable. Light off fruitiness, but not too much. Czech caramel malt. Good one.

On tap. Pours in amber almost red clear bodywith low white head. Aroma has caramel, yeasty, moderate malty with bready tones. Taste has medium caramel sweetness followed by pretty balanced bitterness. Body is full, high carbonation. Nice.

On tap in Pivovarska brana. Decent polotmave, nice head and color, long palate.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

petka z pivovaru. Hazy amber colour, mid-sized off-white head. Lovely aroma of caramel and hops. Medium-bodied, intensive malty base with hints of forest honey, caramel and roasetd malts. Spicy aromatic hops round it off, the smooth and velvety palate transports the flavours perfectly. Another superb beer from this brewery.
Draft. An amber beer with a yellowish head. The aroma has notes of straw, malt, and caramel. The flavor is sweet with notes of straw, caramel, malt, and bread.

Keg at Prague Beerfest. Pours a subtly transparent ruby Broon with a cream head. Aroma of toffee/caramel. Flavour is biscuity with some spicy Saaz. Sweet caramel and light bitterness. Antos seem to be coming on their game.
Pours copper with a beige head. Aroma is malt, roasted notes, nuts and dark fruit. Flavour is malt, caramel, toffee, nuts and light dark fruit.

Its not really a Christmas Tasting in Odense. Copper with a lasting tan head. Malty aroma with bread and biscuit, and faint herbal hops. Sweetish rich malty flavour with herbal and spicy hops and a good and lasting bitter finish.

Tap @ Brewpub. Pours unclear amber with a creamy head. Creamy, smooth and soft texture. Grassy hops and chewy caramel. Bitter hoppy finish. Fresh is the word. Holy ish.. Reminds me of Bastas Polotmavy.
On tap @ the brewpub. Pours hazy amber with a big off-white creamy head.Aroma of weak malts. Taste is light malty with a solid medium bitter finish.
in the brewpub. neutrally aroma, little bit carameliness, amber colour, brown foam, medium bitterness, medium sweetness, medium body, slicky , very good semidark beer, full palate,
user_location: Cambridge and Kladno(Czech Rep.), Cambridgeshire, ENGLAND
